site_name: NATURAL HISTORY EDUCATION CO OF MIDSOUTH

citations.narrative:
During the inspection today there was no shade available for the buteo buteo in the outdoor housing enclosure. The suns
rays were such that the sun was shining into the shelter structure and all other areas of the enclosure. Shade is
necessary to protect the bird from excessive heat and constant bright sunlight. Shelters in outdoor housing must have
areas of shade. Correct by 4/12/24.

The enclosure housing two chickens has a couple of electrical cords inside the enclosure hanging at head height of the
chickens. The chickens may injure themselves on the cords. Primary enclosures must be designed so that they are
structurally sound to house birds and protect the birds from injury. Correct by 3/25/24.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not currently have a written plan in place to address environment enhancement for the bird species
maintained. The plan must address the social grouping needs, environmental enrichment needs and any special
considerations to ensure the psychological well-being of the birds. The facility must develop, document, and follow a
species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement that is species appropriate, is in accordance with currently
accepted professional standards and is approved by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 4/20/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.152(b) 
   
Facilities, outdoor 
During the inspection today there was no shade available for the buteo buteo in the outdoor housing enclosure. The suns 
rays were such that the sun was shining into the shelter structure and all other areas of the enclosure. Shade is 
necessary to protect the bird from excessive heat and constant bright sunlight. Shelters in outdoor housing must have 
areas of shade. Correct by 4/12/24. 
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The enclosure housing two chickens has a couple of electrical cords inside the enclosure hanging at head height of the 
chickens. The chickens may injure themselves on the cords. Primary enclosures must be designed so that they are 
structurally sound to house birds and protect the birds from injury. Correct by 3/25/24. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not currently have a written plan in place to address environment enhancement for the bird species 
maintained. The plan must address the social grouping needs, environmental enrichment needs and any special 
considerations to ensure the psychological well-being of the birds. The facility must develop, document, and follow a 
species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement that is species appropriate, is in accordance with currently 
accepted professional standards and is approved by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 4/20/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
